posts.post_content:
This guy would be great if his CC was a little lower, but a 2/2 for 4CC is pretty brutal. I mean, even with a regular regeneration ability (a la [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeletons) for example) he would still be tough to Justify.
  
   
As usual, [Creakwood Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creakwood Liege) helps out immensely, giving you a 4/4 which is a lot easier to stomach. The fact that he is a zombie doesn't hurt either, as he will benefit from zombie-centric cards like [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron).
  
   
2.5/5, but really only due to combo potential.
posts.html:
This guy would be great if his CC was a little lower, but a 2/2 for 4CC is pretty brutal. I mean, even with a regular regeneration ability (a la Drudge Skeletons for example) he would still be tough to Justify.

As usual, Creakwood Liege helps out immensely, giving you a 4/4 which is a lot easier to stomach. The fact that he is a zombie doesn't hurt either, as he will benefit from zombie-centric cards like Death Baron.

2.5/5, but really only due to combo potential.

Posted By: Gaussgoat (2/10/2010 7:47:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is bad not only because it's a 2/2 for 4, but because its ability is anti-synergistic with a dredge deck. You want to keep your creature cards in your graveyard to fuel Svogthos and Golgari Grave-Troll, not remove them to regenerate a puny 2/2.

posts.post_content:
The flavor text is great, the mechanics are great, the creature subtypes are priceless: 5/5.  
  
It's cards like this that make EDH/Commander so enjoyable for me, because those decks don't have to be super-competitive and it's possible to play cards that are just cool and thematic, like a Plant Zombie in a [Cadaverous Bloom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cadaverous Bloom) deck :)

This is a pure limited card.
  
   
I can't see it being used in casual, obviously not in constructed, it's got no MP chops and it's just not that interesting.
  
   
But in limited sometimes a 2/2 with 'free' regen is what you want.

posts.post_content: [Gift of the Deity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of the Deity) is the only good combo with this card. Otherwise its kinda useless.
